summary: This bill, the "End Prescription Drug Ads Now Act," aims to prohibit drug manufacturers from direct-to-consumer advertising. It amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to classify advertising within the most recent 30-day period as a violation. This includes advertising via various media, such as television, social media, and print, targeting consumers. The ban applies to drugs approved under specific sections of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act and the Public Health Service Act, taking effect 30 days after enactment.
